actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide that multicandidate political committee contributions to a candidate in a Senate or House of Representatives election may constitute only one-third of the total of contributions accepted by the candidate.
short_title: Fairness in Campaign Finance Act of 1991

summary.text: Fairness in Campaign Finance Act of 1991 - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit a candidate for the Senate or the House of Representatives from accepting a contribution from a multicandidate political committee if the amount of such contribution plus the total of multicandidate political committee contributions previously accepted during the same calendar quarter exceeds one-third of the sum of such contribution and the total of contributions previously accepted from all sources during that calendar quarter.

titles.title: Fairness in Campaign Finance Act of 1991

To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide that multicandidate political committee contributions to a candidate in a Senate or House of Representatives election may constitute only one-third of the total of contributions accepted by the candidate.
